channel.title: Comments on: Not a WPF Annoyance — IsOpen on Menus, etc.

item.title: By: Crossed Reality
item.dc:creator: Crossed Reality
item.description:
You are right of course that is makes perfect sense within the WPF framework taken in isolation. Taken as a part of the .Net structure as a whole, however, it does seem somewhat out of place, especially if you've transitioned from Win Forms.
That specific example wasn't all that bad, but it came after an entire morning of fixing random things in a WPF application I'm working on. I might have let my frustration get the better of me a wee bit.
item.content:encoded:
You are right of course that is makes perfect sense within the WPF framework taken in isolation. Taken as a part of the .Net structure as a whole, however, it does seem somewhat out of place, especially if you’ve transitioned from Win Forms.

That specific example wasn’t all that bad, but it came after an entire morning of fixing random things in a WPF application I’m working on. I might have let my frustration get the better of me a wee bit.
